content.description:
Sit start at corner with right hand on good edge and left hand in crimp rail.  Crux is in the first moves as you go up the arret to the big rail about 10 feet up.  Traverse rail right to good edge and finish on easy but heady slopers.

West rock, on the north west corner of the boulder.
Pads and spotters.  The landing is flat directly below the problem, however there are rocks all around the landing which can make the top out extra spicy

Start with your hands on the marginal crimps at head or chest height (depending on how tall you are).  Toss your left heel onto the larger rail out left.  Pull up and slightly right to bad crimps.  Continue straight up on small crimps and top out.  Exiting to the jugs left or right is considered out and makes the route easier.  Superb moves!

Located in the middle of the north face of the west rock.
One pad is fine.  A spotter may be a good idea as you are pretty laid out at the start.

climbs.name: Brian's Phat
climbs.fa: Kent Dunham? -Let me know if you did this first

content.description:
On the West face of the West boulder, nice right traverse on very small, slopey holds.

Sit start on the same holds as "Brians Thin" and make the same opening move to the first crimp rail.  Move right on the shrinking crimps to a verticle slit.  Make a quick move to a sloping pinch, then up to a good edge for your left. Easy top out straight up.
All the problems on this face have blocks that make the landing ugly. This problem is not as high as "Brian's Thin" but some spotters and pads are a must

Sit start on lowest crimp rail. Follow the line of perfect crimp rails straight up the boulder. Amazing half pad to full pad crimps and a spicy finish make this a must do for Big Rock.

West face of the West rock, about 5 feet from the left corner. Very obvious line.
Bring lots friends and pads.  There is a big rock right in the landing area and boulders all around.  Not something you want to try alone.

Obvious crack when looking from the parking lot

Can use gear to set up a TR, otherwise highball

A great endurance problem, adding some very tiring moves before linking into "Torment of Evil." After the crux this problem adds a harder exit to the right. Start at the far left corner of the north face of the boulder. Easy traverse right until you get to a series of edges and a pocket, about 5 feet left of the start hold of "Bob's Liquor Mart." Drop down onto a sloping edge and traverse into the start of "Torment of Evil". Climb through "Torment", but instead of exiting straight up, continue around the corner to a huge rest ledge. Finish by going up and right to the exit of "Brian's Thin."

The large rock under the corner is out. A couple of pads to protect the crux and the exit. The topout is easy compared with the rest of the route, but a fall there would be very bad!

Stand on the small boulder on the right of the face and go straight up the arret to finish on slopey but decent top out

West Boulder, north face.  Starts on the small boulder at the right of the face.
A pad and a few friends if this route is close to your limit

Start on Bob's Liquor Mart crimps.  Traverse right through start hold of X-wing. Keep going right to second sloper rail, then through the crux sequence on small crimps and terrible feet. Join Kallen Route and top out on easy holds.

West Rock, on the north face.
A pad or 2.  The traverse is pretty low and can be worked without pads.

Nice dyno.  Start with both hands on big slightly slopey rail.  Make the toss up and slightly left to the only usable hold up there.  Top out.  Fun.

Just right of "Bob's Liquor Mart."
One pad is fine
The west side of Big Rock
